definition: to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: So it was better to take the backcross method than other methods in anti-strip rust breeding.
sentences.chinese: 由此在抗條鏽育種上採用回交方法的效果較好。

sentences.english: The resistant level was declined with increasing of backcross generations.
sentences.chinese: 在回交後代中，抗性水平逐代降低。

sentences.english: Backcross makes a notable impact eff ection on improving fibre yield and long fibre content.
sentences.chinese: 回交法對提高亞麻出麻率和纖維產量上效果顯著。

sentences.english: The results were verified by backcross inheritance experiment.
sentences.chinese: 上述結果通過回交試驗得到進一步驗證。

sentences.english: So it was difficult to obtain seeds by backcross.
sentences.chinese: 但受精指數仍然較低，很難獲得回交種子。

sentences.english: The related techniques in backcross breeding were also discussed.
sentences.chinese: 對回交育種中的有關技術也進行了討論。

sentences.english: Dwarfing-sterile wheat was changed from winterness to springness by continue backcross.
sentences.chinese: 利用連續回交手段將矮敗小麥由冬性轉育爲春性。

sentences.english: The sprouting percentage of hybrid progenies was reduced by backcrossing with the resistant parents.
sentences.chinese: 用抗性親本回交可提高其後代的抗穗發芽性。

sentences.english: The method can be conveniently applied to practical backcross breeding programs.
sentences.chinese: 該方法可以很方便地應用於實際的回交育種。

definition: to pass to the next generation
allopolyploid (polyploid with chromosomes of different species)
